frame.name: Undergo_transformation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> changes from one kind of thing (<fen>Initial_category</fen>) to another kind of thing (<fen>Final_category</fen>). Whether the <fen>Initial_category</fen> is mentioned or not, the change is viewed as negating some <fen>Initial_category</fen>, and not simply adding an additional <fen>Final_category</fen> to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Entity">She</fex> <t>metamorphosed</t> <fex name="Initial_category">from a mere coworker</fex> <fex name="Final_category">into a friend</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">His mother</fex> had <t>transformed</t> <fex name="Final_category">into a rock star</fex> . <fex name="Initial_category">INI</fex> </ex> <ex>The <t>metamorphosis</t> <fex name="Entity">of his attitude</fex> <fex name="Initial_category">from benign neglect</fex> <fex name="Final_category">to active hatred</fex> was so slow he never noticed .</ex> <ex>The <t>transformation</t> <fex name="Initial_category">from Ms. Nobody</fex> had taken her years . <fex name="Entity">DNI</fex> <fex name="Final_category">INI</fex> </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
<ex>How pleasing to see that <fex name="ent">Scranton</fex> has <t>metamorphosed</t> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Final_category
FE.definition:
<def-root>The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.
<ex>His smile <t>transformed</t> <fex name="Final_category">into a frown</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Initial_category
FE.definition:
<def-root>The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
<ex>The viccar <t>converted</t> <fex name="inic">from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation.
<ex><fex name="tim">Then</fex> she <t>turned</t> into a lizard.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the Transformation event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
<ex>Dublin is experiencing the <fex name="Manner">same</fex> <t>transformation</t> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the initial and final categories differ from each other.
<ex>The formula had not yet <t>transformed</t> <fex name="Degree">completely</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The physical or abstract <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the change takes place. </def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event or state that causes the change to take place.
<ex>Doctors' practices have undergone a <t>metamorphosis</t> <fex name="cau">due to concerns over medical litigation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location that the change takes place.</def-root>
